Zombies und andere Monster abschlachten, Wildes geballer und dazu noch geile Musik. Das alles ist Killing Floor.

Wer auf diesen Totalen Freakigen Shooter steht der sollte auf jeden Fall mal reinschauen.

Killing Floor é um FPS de ondas, onde o jogador junta dinheiro pra comprar armas e upar personagens enquanto a partida avança, fez um enorme sucesso anos atrás (eu não peguei essa época porque estava ocupado com outros jogos) e ainda tem um pouco de gente jogando ainda hoje (embora possa ser dificil pra um iniciante jogar com os hardcore restantes).
O gunplay é satisfatório, existe muita variedade e os gráficos são bons pra um jogo de 2009. Recomendo se você quiser jogar solo ou com amigos, jogar online com desconhecido hoje em dia pode ser dificil. não é um jogo pra mim, mas achei um bom passatempo.
------------------
Killing Floor is a wave mode  FPS, where the player collects money to buy weapons and level up characters as the game progresses, it was a huge success years ago (I didn't catch that time because I was busy with other games) and there's still a few people still playing today (although it can be difficult for a beginner to play with the remaining hardcore).
The gunplay is satisfactory, there is a lot of variety and the graphics are good for a 2009 game. I recommend it if you want to play solo or with friends, playing online with strangers these days can be difficult. It's not a game for me, but I found it a good pastime.

Over a decade after its initial release, Killing Floor holds up as an entertaining and challenging co-op game. It's a fun action RPG dressed up in a zombie - err, [i]mutant clone[/i] - survival theme, taking itself just seriously enough to make its atmosphere work. It has a killer soundtrack, very unique voicework, and distinct mechanics that take time and practice to master. It's enjoyable alone, though you'll have the most fun playing with teammates.

Killing Floor is set after an outbreak of "specimens" from a shady corporation terrorizes England. You and up to five other teammates enter infested territories like Western London and an abandoned water treatment facility, fighting off waves of monsters until you reach a climactic final boss fight. Killing enemies gives you cash that you can use to buy new guns, ammo, and body armor. You can choose one of seven perks to play as, like the melee-focused Berserker or the explosive-enhancing Demolitions. Each perk grants you bonus stats that increase as they rank up, eventually granting you starting items and price decreases. 

You can weld doors shut to keep out specimens, try to "kite" enemies around maps and whittle down their numbers, or just pick a spot and hold out against the onslaught. You'll learn new strategies as you master each map. Enemies also have a surprising amount of weaknesses and strengths to keep in mind. Some are just made to pad out the wave count, like the slow-moving Clot and the annoying Crawler. Others are more unique, like the fireball-launching Husk and projectile-vaporizing Siren. Minibosses like the chainsaw-carrying Scrake and rage-prone Fleshpound require team cooperation or careful tactics to defeat, as they can inflict lethal attacks if their health drops below a certain point. They're all pretty unique and can be dangerous in their own rights, especially on the last two difficulties.

Survival in Killing Floor hinges on using your perk to its fullest potential. Each perk has their own weapons that take advantage of their bonuses, like assault rifles for the Commando and incendiary weapons for the Firebug. Some perks are better-suited for teamplay (like the Field Medic) while others can do well alone (like the Support Specialist). The perk system is cool and rewards continued play, though it gets increasingly grindy and tedious to level them up. Hard mode is best saved for when your perks are at level 2 or 3, while Suicidal and Hell on Earth modes should be saved for level 5 or 6 perks. The highest difficulties can border on being unfair with high enemy health and nerfed player abilities, meaning that you might not go beyond Hard if you're just in the game to have fun.

All of the game's maps are available for free, as well as some characters and most weapons. Twelve weapons are locked behind Community Weapon Pack DLCs (only the first is really worth buying), and a couple others have more outlandish ways to get unlocked (own Rising Storm, [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2144450008]work around a broken unlock feature[/url]). The remaining DLCs just unlock cosmetic weapon skins or player characters, none of which affect gameplay at all. 

There is still a decently sized player count for Killing Floor in 2022. You can find people to play games on most difficulties, especially at night. This is honestly one of the best ways to enjoy the game, as the increased enemy total and health amounts make for some intense and thrilling battles alongside friends and strangers. You can usually hop into a Beginner or Normal difficulty match without issues, and the community is friendly enough to help out newcomers. Stay away from Hard, Suicidal, or Hell on Earth difficulties until you reach the recommended perk levels, though! Those can be brutal and unforgiving, especially the last two ones.

I would recommend buying Killing Floor, especially for fans of Left 4 Dead 2 and other co-op games. It has a lot of free content to enjoy, and the DLC can be purchased together for a reasonable price on sale. Even then, the base game includes a lot of fun bonuses to unlock, like special characters and a laser machine gun. $19.99 is a fair price for the amount of time I spent with the game, though I would wait for a sale so you can purchase it alongside its DLC for a bargain. The frantic gameplay, explosive and gory action, and fun PvE dynamic make it a great game to play with friends.

一句话评测：感觉这个其实像是：血肉加强版的求生之路。

杀戮空间和求生之路，两者在某种层面上说，其实都大致可以算得上是：
僵尸题材的第一人称割草射击游戏，但是侧重点不同：
假若说求生之路是割草机割掉一茬又一茬的野草的话，那么杀戮空间就是割草是漫天纷飞的乱草飘洒的场面。
求生之路的爽点在于：你和队友干掉一波接一波的丧尸——着重在丧尸的数量上；
而杀戮空间的爽点在于，你和队友将一波接一波的丧尸干掉成怎么样——这里不是指分数，而是指血肉横飞的画面：假若你并不满足求生之路那种并不太真实的几何图形的血肉横飞感，不妨来试试杀戮空间这款更加偏向注重真实血肉横飞的感觉，绝对能给你另一种不一样的感官刺激。

Итак, я по каким-то неизвестным никому причинам пишу отзыв на первую часть после того, как написал на вторую. И этот отзыв будет полон самокопирования. Суть такова, что мне нравятся обе части - соответственно, как захотел, так и написал. 
По большому счёту - это незамутнённый зомби-шутер.
Для меня лично в спорах "что лучше - L4D / L4D2 или KF / KF2" всегда побеждал Killing Floor обе части, так как, несмотря на то, что обе франшизы про убийство зомби, прохождение отдельно взятых сценариев меня никогда так сильно не увлекало.
Здесь же я могу расслабиться, полностью отключив голову, и просто наслаждаться стволами, пляшущими в руках, и косить орды нечисти налево и направо. Не знаю, процесс "тупо перестрелки на арене против зомбаков, прущих на тебя отовсюду" почему-то меня развлекает, не напрягая и не наскучивая. Наиграл кучу времени и наиграю ещё.

Из плюсов тут : нетребовательное железо, есть некое количество классов, атмосферный музон, приятный ко-оп. Ну и Иисус с ракетницей. 
Из минусов: ошибки оптимизации, приводящие иногда к вылету в винду, к вылету с серверов, к фризам. Косметика донатная; графон посредственный, но терпимо удобоваримый. Ко-оп я занёс в плюс, но вот совместно залететь на сервер то ещё испытание, так что именно менеджмент серверов в кооперативе занесу, пожалуй, в минус. 
В целом, хороший незамутнённый зомби-шутер. Играется нормально даже в наши дни.
